metadata.title: CVE-2015-2305 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the regcomp implementation in the Henry Spencer BSDregex library (aka rxspencer) alpha3.8.g5 on 32-bit platforms, as used inNetBSD through 6.1.5 and other products, might allow context-dependentattackers to execute arbitrary code via a large regular expression thatleads to a heap-based buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2305` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

librcsb-core-wrapper0 - 1.005-3
python-corepywrap - 1.005-3
No subscription required

libnewlib-arm-none-eabi - 2.1.0-3
No subscription required

vigor - 0.016-24
No subscription required

clamav - 0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu1
clamav-base - 0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu1
clamav-daemon - 0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu1
clamav-freshclam - 0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu1
clamav-milter - 0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu1
clamav-testfiles - 0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu1
clamdscan - 0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libclamav9 - 0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

nvi - 1.81.6-13
No subscription required

libradare2-3.2 - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
libradare2-common - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
radare2 - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: librcsb-core-wrapper package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.005-3').
newlib package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-3').
vigor package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.016-24').
clamav package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu1').
nvi package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.81.6-13').
radare2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.0+dfsg-2').
